text: anchovy has a very different flavor from
salmon it has a richness it has a depth
has a saltiness which works really well
with the ocean flavor of the salmon the
secret to this recipe is how I'm using
the anchovy butter I use half of it to
cook the salmon and then at the end I
stir some more anchovy butter into the
pan to make a quick sauce this is pretty
much it that's all the prep you need
sear it on the skin side to get it a
little bit crispy look at the bottom
where the fish meets the pan you see
that white line that white line means
that that part of the fish is cooking so
that you know that the heat is radiating
up it's cooking the fish and therefore
the skin is getting crisp the first time
that I made this recipe I thought I
could finish cooking it using the
broiler but I actually like it better in
the oven
I want crisp skin but I want soft flesh
and this is when we just add the rest of
the anchovy butter and then it's not
really gonna cook it's just sort of melt
and then you're gonna get the flavor of
raw anchovy and raw garlic which is very
delicious I just want to cut all the
richness with a little bit of acid
anchovy butter is good on everything you
can use it for the salmon but you can
also just spread it on toast you could
cook eggs in it oh my gosh scrambled
eggs and anchovy butter how good would
that babe
